Faults.message:
Storm Eunice is currently and continues to cause significant impact to the electricity network and our customer’s supplies. Due to this we currently cannot guarantee electricity supplies will be restored soon. Our workforce, which was enhanced in preparation for the storm, has been mobilised and we’re working hard to restore customer supplies as quickly and safely as possible. The first priority will be to get the power restored to as many homes as possible by altering our network around the damage - this may mean your power is restored sooner than stated on this fault. Updates for this job will be provided when accurate information is received from colleagues in the field.

For updates on what we’re doing to restore power and how we’re responding to the storm, along with helpful advice, please click here.

Faults.name: RG20 Area

Faults.message:
We’re very sorry for the power cut. Our teams are working hard to restore your power, however, due to weather conditions that have impacted our network, and will continue to do so through to Friday, it may take longer than normal to restore power. We’re experiencing a busier than usual period and the conditions mean that even with additional teams we have mobilised, it’s much harder to repair faults due to the safety implications of working on our network in such conditions.

We will continue to update you with the latest information here on Power Track, so we’d recommend you register for updates on this fault or check back in later.

If you are in need of extra support, such as requiring electricity for medical equipment, you can call us on 105 where our team is on hand to help.

For updates on how we’re dealing with the weather, along with helpful advice, please click here.
Faults.name: PH7 Area
